meanings.definition: A person or thing that dispels something.
meanings.sent1: The dispeller of darkness, the flashlight, helped us find our way in the dark forest.
meanings.sent2: The dispeller of rumors, Sarah, clarified the situation for everyone.
meanings.sent3: The dispeller of boredom, the new board game, kept us entertained for hours.
meanings.sent4: The dispeller of confusion, the teacher, explained the lesson clearly.
meanings.sent5: The dispeller of loneliness, the friendly dog, always kept me company.

meanings.definition: To make something disappear or go away.
meanings.sent1: The magician used his wand to dispeller the rabbit from the hat.
meanings.sent2: The warm sun helped dispeller the morning mist.
meanings.sent3: I wish I could dispeller my chores with a snap of my fingers.
meanings.sent4: The wind can dispeller the clouds, revealing a clear blue sky.
meanings.sent5: The soap can dispeller the dirt from your hands, leaving them clean.

meanings.sent1: The scarecrow helped dispeller the birds from the cornfield.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise was enough to dispeller the deer from the garden.
meanings.sent3: The smell of the delicious food seemed to dispeller all my worries.
meanings.sent4: The strong wind can dispeller the fallen leaves from the path.
meanings.sent5: The guard dog can dispeller intruders from the property.
